arm_group.description: Subjects are submitted to endoloop-assisted "ligate and let go" colorectal polypectomy.
Subjects are submitted to endoloop-assisted snare colorectal polypectomy

brief_summary.textblock:
The aims of this study were to examine: 1) safety and feasibility of antiplatelet therapy
      interruption 7 days prior to polypectomy in patients with long-term antiplatelet therapy; 2)
      safety and feasibility of endoloop assisted snare polypectomy in patients with long-term
      antiplatelet therapy;  3) safety and feasibility of so called "ligate and let go" approach
      in patients with long-term antiplatelet therapy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing Endoloop-assisted Polypectomy in Patients With Antiplatelet Therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  pedunculated colorectal polyps

          -  larger than 2cm in diameter

          -  long-term antiplatelet therapy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  presence of intraepithelial

intervention.description: The technique implies placement of endoloop snare on the base of large pedunculated colorectal polyps without consecutive snare polypectomy.
intervention.intervention_name: Endoloop-assisted "ligate and let go" colorectal polypectomy

intervention.description: The technique implies placement of endoloop snare on the base of large pedunculated colorectal polyps with consecutive snare polypectomy.

clinical_study.official_title: Endoloop-assisted Colorectal Polypectomy or "Ligate and Let go" in Patients With Long-term Antiplatelet Therapy

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
